intro: Catacline sericea, commonly known as silky catacline, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its soft, silvery-gray foliage, which helps it retain moisture in harsh environments. Its small, daisy-like flowers typically bloom in shades of yellow and white, attracting various pollinators. Catacline sericea is often found growing along rocky outcrops and in sandy soils, showcasing its adaptability to extreme conditions.
